result.execSummary:
The defendant Grayson A. Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grayson A. Gordon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Grayson A Gordon in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 13CM497 (sentencing), 15CM4 (plea & sentencing)
11:43 a.m.  Court calls the cases.

  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM4 Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM4 Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM4 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

BY THE COURT:  13CM497 - Court finds there is a violation and Court enters the Judgment of Conviction today's date.  

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
13CM497 Count 1 - 
Serve 20 days jail -STAYED-
Huber if approved by the jail administration.
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months:
Court costs have been previously paid. 
20 hours community service.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and controlled substances
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 

15CM4 Count 2-
Serve 30 days jail, consecutive to any sentence he might be serving -STAYED-
3 days credit.
Huber if approved by the jail administration.
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 13CM497. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Parties address jail credit in 15CM4.
Plea hearing on April 10, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Grayson A. Gordon in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court received the petition for appointment of counsel.  Court has reviewed that and found the defendant is not indigent.  Petition is denied. 

Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court on defendant's behalf. 
Defendant would like to consult with counsel and believes he will have one. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
$1,000 sig bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

DA case #15PT16
ADA Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, Resist/obstruct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 sig bond:    with conditions as stated.

BTC: $1,000 sig bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.



Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   01-12-2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch  1
